content: Who wrote the Pulitzer Prize-winning play 'A Streetcar Named Desire', which was later adapted into an Oscar-winning film?

I believe it was Tennessee Williams who wrote the Pulitzer Prize-winning play 'A Streetcar Named Desire'. He was a renowned American playwright known for his works that often explored complex human emotions and relationships. The play was indeed adapted into a successful film, starring Marlon Brando and Vivien Leigh, which received several Oscars.
